suggestions.original: To improve the picture organization, consider simplifying some of the crowded areas to enhance the flow and readability of the artwork. You could reduce the number of overlapping patterns and shapes, especially in the central and left sections, to create more breathing space. Additionally, try to balance the distribution of colors and elements more evenly across the composition to avoid any single area feeling too congested. This will help in guiding the viewer's eye more smoothly through the entire piece.
suggestions.current: Rather than simplifying the crowded areas, you might consider embracing the complexity of the overlapping patterns to create a more layered and intricate composition. Allowing some congestion in certain areas can add visual interest and encourage the viewer to explore different parts of the artwork. Maintaining the current distribution of colors and elements will keep the piece dynamic and engaging.
